messages: 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:36): finds http://lists.w3.org/Archives/Member/w3c-wai-pf/2008JulSep/0509.html (W3C-Member only)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:43): mmm, condescenscion
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:50): for the window.foreignXHR = otherWindow.XMLHttpRequest case I'd expect window.document to be the Document pointer
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (13:50): It's good to know nothing goes on in the w3c that needs hiding
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:51): the PFWG should really be public, not sure why it isn't
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:51): they are the experts
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:51): why should they need outside input?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:52): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: if you expect that, you expect the "this" object to be used, but in that case the randomObject case should fail
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (13:52): Oh, I would never suggest such a thing, merely that we might want insight in their wisdom
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:52): They should open up and try to emulate the great success of public-html
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:52): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, I feel another HTML5 dependency coming
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:53): public-webapps works pretty well
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:54): I think public-html fails because the launch of the HTML WG got so much publicity
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:54): and because HTML is such a central piece of the Web technology stack
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:54): and because it is easier to wrongly believe you understand HTML than to do so with CSS or DOM APIs
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (13:54): webapps attracts implementors and people who write relatively advanced JS
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:55): these factors contribute to a much higher level of highly opinionated but poorly informed people
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:55): www-style has that too for less technical topics
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:56): and people who are there not to provide expertise but to score political points for their pet objectives
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:56): public-webapps is one of the best standards mailing lists I am on
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:56): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, weinig, http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/webapps/20080926
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:56): hilited the relevant bits
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:57): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: yeah, that's what Gecko does
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:58): which does not appear to match the spec as I read it
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:58): not sure what IE does
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:58): the Gecko behavior would not be hard to implement

6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (13:59): ah yes, "The associated Document object is the one returned by the document attribute from the object on which the XMLHttpRequest() constructor was invoked (a Window object)." needs some tweaking
